152.sentence: Cons. 1. Configuration is not easy as it made out to be 2.Lousy Initial Software 3. Does not work with BitSpirit with UPnP, Besides that its an excellent choice , If you know your way around network configuration go for it.

153.sentence: Both of them keep disconnecting on me and interruptions are 3 or 4 times per day at best.

155.sentence: Purchased this router a few months back, NO PROBLEMS whatsoever.

156.sentence: In fact, it supports the new WPA encryption standard, which is WAY better than WEP.

157.sentence: Works perfectly with my netgear wireless PCMCIA.

158.sentence: Feature wise, its a lot better than the dlink and netgear routers out there.

159.sentence: Was a bit wary because the software is Windows only and I have an iMac.

160.sentence: Reset the network, tried the connection, and it's working like a charm.

161.sentence: The downside being that the Tivo can only connect at 802.11b speeds and not 802.11g.

162.sentence: However since this Router is backward compatible, that doesn't pose a problem at all.

163.sentence: Overall, it'll make my move that much easier knowing I don't have to worry about connectivity.

164.sentence: (...)  Like most SOHO routers, it has nearly non-existant logging.

165.sentence: For more than a year, and it is totally reliable.

166.sentence: No down time, great signal strength.

167.sentence: There is an open-source firmware on the net which has tons of extra features.

168.sentence: Setup is totally breeze and Linksys's web site is pretty easy to navigate.

169.sentence: Now this router is not the cheapest on the market.

170.sentence: The fact that has an open-source firmware makes it a great option in my opinion.
